channel.title: Imagination
channel.description:
Is one of the most powerful things I think.
You can imagine anything. And with such clarity.
I drive down the highway and I imagine giant hammers and balls swinging into cars sending them crashing into things and I have never seen that happen but I can picture it with such detail that I can see their horrified faces and arms being torn and broken and glass that cuts into the cars around them.
I can imagine things that I have no idea what they would actually look like but it seems so real.
If there was any way to use our brains as computers or our imagination to record movies of what we're seeing or something, the possibilities would be endless.
Discuss: Imagination. Awesome things to imagine. Etc.
Right now, I am imagining Pokemon are real. And I have a pet Marill.

item.title: Imagination
item.dc:creator: @Square Square
item.description:
@Square wrote:

[quote=“Davidude, post:17, topic:265832”]I disagree, imagination is highly over rated. I say this because the human mind is unable to create anything brand new. For example try to imagine a creature that nobody has imagined before. Do you dare to dream? Is it really a brand new idea?

Well now look at your creature, I bet that even if it appears brand new it is just made of old ideas that you have seen and sensed before. For example you’ve sensed teeth, and you’ve sensed large, so you could give your creature large teeth.[/quote]Now i remember; it was Davidude who talked about the golden mountains

Read full topic

item.title: Imagination
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“Davidude, post:17, topic:265832”]I disagree, imagination is highly over rated. I say this because the human mind is unable to create anything brand new. For example try to imagine a creature that nobody has imagined before. Do you dare to dream? Is it really a brand new idea?

Well now look at your creature, I bet that even if it appears brand new it is just made of old ideas that you have seen and sensed before. For example you’ve sensed teeth, and you’ve sensed large, so you could give your creature large teeth.[/quote]

As far as this whole brand new idea goes, the creature could be a collection of things from previous knowledge (what a lot of our sight is based on) but that doesn’t mean it’s not original or not stretching our imagination. We have words to describe almost everything. It’s hard to think of a creature with an aspect we don’t understand, ie a creature that has a 4th dimension or, well it’s hard to say considering we’re talking about ways to describe something that haven’t yet been thought of.

As far as still being imaginative, or even as another rebuttal, I can probably think of a creature no one has thought of before. It’d have an incredibly weird but useless body with a wacky shape. And maybe people as teeth. It still has teeth because we know what they are and it’s paired with a lot of life forms but it’s teeth are a separate living entity besides being joined to the creature.

Read full topic

item.title: Imagination
item.dc:creator: @sanga282 sanga282
item.description:
@sanga282 wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:20, topic:265832”][quote author=sanga282 link=topic=350999.msg2695667#msg2695667 date=1236249469]
theres a theory that the human mind cant create anything, it just blends
[/quote]

Well, if you want to look at it that way, there is only a set of basic things that humans can perceive, and anything at all is necessarily a mixture of them. There’s the line, the curve, colors, tastes, smells, emotions, hot & cold, and some other stuff; and anything we can conceptualize is some combination of these. It all depends on how you define “something”.[/quote]
effectively yes; heat emotions basic sense and nature are all we can perceive really everything else is a blend of these, however a definition of genius that i find most insightful is this

Genius: seeing what everyone else see's but drawing a different conclusion
so perhaps most humans are not able to create whereas a genius can create something entirely different to what ordinary people will

Read full topic

item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:

sanga282:

theres a theory that the human mind cant create anything, it just blends

Well, if you want to look at it that way, there is only a set of basic things that humans can perceive, and anything at all is necessarily a mixture of them. There’s the line, the curve, colors, tastes, smells, emotions, hot & cold, and some other stuff; and anything we can conceptualize is some combination of these. It all depends on how you define “something”.

Well now look at your creature, I bet that even if it appears brand new it is just made of old ideas that you have seen and sensed before. For example you’ve sensed teeth, and you’ve sensed large, so you could give your creature large teeth.[/quote]

item.title: Imagination
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

jme:

Man you guys don’t know what your imagination is capable of, until you have a strong salvia experience. Like, I’m not sure anything compares.

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=-3JCESdFNyw

[quote=“Davidude, post:17, topic:265832”]I disagree, imagination is highly over rated. I say this because the human mind is unable to create anything brand new. For example try to imagine a creature that nobody has imagined before. Do you dare to dream? Is it really a brand new idea?

Well now look at your creature, I bet that even if it appears brand new it is just made of old ideas that you have seen and sensed before. For example you’ve sensed teeth, and you’ve sensed large, so you could give your creature large teeth.[/quote]

This is only because we have terminology to express ideas that already exist. It’s not impossible to imagine something entirely new, it’s only impossible to discuss it intelligently because there are no words to describe it.

Read full topic

item.title: Imagination
item.dc:creator: @Square Square
item.description:
@Square wrote:

[quote=“Javacisnotrecognized, post:9, topic:265832”]http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Lucid_Dreaming[/quote]There was a thread about this before. All i remember about it was that as long as you can think of gold, and you can think of a mountain, you have the capability of thinking of a gold mountain. =\ That, and the fact that keeping a log of your dreams for a long period of time will give you good control over a majority of your dreams.

Read full topic

item.title: Imagination
item.dc:creator: @Javacisnotrecognized _^_
item.description:
@Javacisnotrecognized wrote:

en.wikipedia.org

Lucid dream

A lucid dream is a dream during which one is aware that one is dreaming. During a lucid dream, one may gain some amount of control over the dream characters, narrative, and environment. The term 'lucid dream' was coined by Dutch author and psychiatrist Frederik van Eeden in his 1913 article A Study of Dreams, though descriptions of dreamers being aware that they are dreaming predates the actual term. Frederik Van Eeden studied his personal dreams since 1896. He wrote down the most interesting o...

Read full topic

item.title: Imagination
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

[quote=“Square, post:6, topic:265832”][quote author=SomethingToHide link=topic=350999.msg2695385#msg2695385 date=1236220126]
If there was any way to use our brains as computers or our imagination to record movies of what we’re seeing or something, all possibilities would be ended.
[/quote]You know some crazy ass will just use it to bring about the end of the world.

I imagine scenarios in class all day just to pass the time. ;)[/quote]

Me too. They’re mostly about someone kicking the door in and blowing someone’s head off with a shotgun and everyone running wildly around.

But sometimes they’re about zombies trying to take over our school and me and some friends kicking their asses.

Read full topic

item.title: Imagination
item.dc:creator: @SomethingToHide STH
item.description:
@SomethingToHide wrote:

Exactly.

And you don’t even have to be super creative to imagine things.

Imagine your past, bring up memories, or imagine something simple like a street with people on it. Imagine the people and what they are wearing.

I think that’s why people like books. It’s like a trip for your imagination to go on. While you read it your imagination does all the work and pictures it in your head and the book just guides you.

Read full topic

item.title: Imagination
item.dc:creator: @PeterMan PeterMan
item.description:
@PeterMan wrote:

SomethingToHide:

Right now, I am imagining Pokemon are real. And I have a pet Marill.

Lol’d

Well, when I was about 6 years old I was so impressed by skateboarding that when I was bored in the car, I could see myself out the window skating along with the car speed, railing ontop of other cars, jumping around etc. It felt so real.

Read full topic
